title: Math 222 and Preps
body:
I’ve been told by some juniors and seniors that math 222 builds off 221, and I should take Preps for it b/c of my AP credit from AB. Unfortunately, it doesn’t fit in my schedule. What content am I missing with just my AP Calc AB credit instead of taking 221. 

TLDR: what content is missing from the AP Calc AB credit that’s taught in 221 and used in 222
comments:
Personally (straight to 222 but helped people with 221), there was only one unit my AP calc AB didn’t cover. If I remember correctly it was implicit differentiation? But it was a minimal amount of catch-up work. I did have a better professor than most (Erman) so he might deserve most of the credit lol

I think if you’re comfortable with your AB calc knowledge, there’s no need to take 221. But it’s probably a good idea to get a hold of the syllabus (or even a textbook/packet, you can see previous editions online) and see if everything looks familiar.
